content.question: Which of the following best explains the differences between countries with higher and lower percentages of women working in agriculture?

choices.label: Places where subsistence farming is still practiced tend to have few women working in agriculture.
The Green Revolution enabled most women to stop working in subsistence agriculture.
There is little agriculture in the Western Hemisphere, and few women are employed in commercial agriculture.
Countries with large percentages of female employment in agriculture tend to be mostly rural and are reliant on subsistence agriculture.
Countries with large populations tend to have the most women working in agriculture, usually commercial agriculture.

content.answer: Countries with large percentages of female employment in agriculture tend to be mostly rural and are reliant on subsistence agriculture.

unit.text: 5: Agriculture and Rural Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Compare patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
